abstract: Citigroup marketed dozens of collateralized debt obligation deals in the run-up to the financial crisis but now claims to have settled all its potential liability, write two reporters at ProPublica.
snippet: Citigroup marketed dozens of collateralized debt obligation deals in the run-up to the financial crisis but now claims to have settled all its potential liability, write two reporters at ProPublica.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup marketed dozens of collateralized debt obligation deals in the period leading up to the financial crisis but it claims to have settled all its potential liability by settling with the Securities and Exchange Commission over one C.D.O. transaction, write Jesse Eisinger and Jake Bernstein of ProPublica. Read more »
